text: in this video we're going to talk about

buoyancy
is an upward force
this force is present any time you
submerge an object in a fluid
the fluid could be water or it could
even be air
the buoyant force
is equal
to the weight of the displaced fluid
and so it's equal to
the density of the fluid
times the volume of the submerged object
times the gravitational acceleration
now you can't really change the density

the most part fixed
it's one gram per milliliter
or a thousand kilograms per cubic meter
that's the density of water

in direction to the weight of the object

but the upward buoyant force wants to
lift it up and so anytime you hold an
object and if you put it under water you
could feel that
it feels lighter underwater than when
you raise it out of water for example if
you were to take a brick in your hand
it would feel heavy in your hand but if

going to feel lighter
and this is due to the upward point
force which makes it feel like
the weight is less
it doesn't really change the weight of

what causes

that object is going to
